fields.description: As a cloudformation user, I would like to be able to support UpdateStack with AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer

comments.body:
Subnets require replacement if changed.
SecurityGroups return to the default group when empty, except for the default vpc case, in which case the group goes to the "ELB created security group used when no security group is specified during ELB creation - modifications could impact traffic to future ELBs" group.
Changing the LoadBalancerName requires Replacement.  However, if the name is set and unchanged, and you try to change other things that require replacement, you will get an error.
Updating Tags requires no interruption.  Use eulb-describe-tags <lb>

To test health check, add something like the following snippet to the template:
{code}
        "HealthCheck" : {
          "HealthyThreshold" : "2",
          "Interval" : "5",
          "Target" : "HTTP:8080/"
          "Timeout" : "30",
          "UnhealthyThreshold" :"4"
        },
{code}

Then try updating the stack, and playing with the values.  Going from a stack with no health check to adding one in, or starting with a stack that has a health check, and removing the health check, the update will require replacement.  If there is a health check defined in both the old and new stack, a simple no-interruption update will occur.

If there is no health check defined, it should default to the following
{code}
        <HealthCheck>
          <Target>TCP:80</Target>
          <Interval>30</Interval>
          <Timeout>5</Timeout>
          <UnhealthyThreshold>3</UnhealthyThreshold>
          <HealthyThreshold>3</HealthyThreshold>
        </HealthCheck>
{code}

One way to check various items of the load balancer is to do eulb-describe-lbs 2>&1 | grep ResponseMetadata | xmllint --format -

A lot of stuff comes back from the eulb-describe-lbs command and it would be way to much to show in one display.
